com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue

Interface YDMGetNextContainerSCMUE


  • public interface YDMGetNextContainerSCMUE
    gets the next SCM.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getNextContainerSCM(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The YDMGetNextContainerSCMUE user exit is called by the generateSCM API.

    • Method Detail

      • getNextContainerSCM

        org.w3c.dom.Document getNextContainerSCM(YFSEnvironment env,
                                         org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                  throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YDMGetNextContainerSCMUE user exit is called by the generateSCM API. To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the methods in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the method in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.

        The user exit implementation can get the enterprise code from the environment variable by calling the getUEParam(String variable) method.

        Example : env.getUEParam("EnterpriseCode")


        Related Yantra Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD

        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called only if the container does not have a ContainerSCM and GenerateContainerScm is set in the input XML.

        Post-conditions: The return parameter should contain XML document to create a ContainerSCM.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.


        Returns:
        An XML document that contains data required to create ContainerSCM. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
